semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Encounter for Complication Associated with Neoplasm
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 2. Chapter 2: Neoplasms > l. Sequencing of neoplasm codes > 4) Encounter for complication associated with a neoplasm

content.full_text: When an encounter is for management of a complication associated with a neoplasm, such as dehydration, and the treatment is only for the complication, the complication is coded first, followed by the appropriate code(s) for the neoplasm. The exception to this guideline is anemia. When the admission/encounter is for management of an anemia associated with the malignancy, and the treatment is only for anemia, the appropriate code for the malignancy is sequenced as the principal or first-listed diagnosis followed by code D63.0, Anemia in neoplastic disease. (Evidence: pg no: 37, L37-L39)
content.summary: Guidelines for sequencing when treating complications of neoplasms, with special exception for anemia (Evidence: pg no: 37, L37-L39)
key_concepts: Complication coded first when treatment is only for complication (Evidence: pg no: 37, L37-L38)
Neoplasm code follows complication code (Evidence: pg no: 37, L38)
Exception for anemia - malignancy sequenced first (Evidence: pg no: 37, L38-L39)
Use D63.0 for anemia in neoplastic disease (Evidence: pg no: 37, L39)
